title: Suadela
extract:
In Roman mythology, Suadela (or Suada) was a goddess of persuasion, particularly in romance, seduction and love. She was strongly associated with Venus. Her Greek name was Peitho. Sometimes she is associated with or counted as one of the Graces. Plutarch observed in his Quaestiones Romanae (part of Moralia) that the married couple had need of five gods: Nuptial Jupiter, Nuptial Juno, Venus, Suada, and above all Diana, whom women call upon in childbirth.
